title: Hameln
overview: Return of the Pied Piper In the Middle Ages he kidnapped 130 children. Now the Pied Piper of Hamelin is returning with them after almost eight centuries. Only a blind woman, a deaf man and a person with a walking disability can stop him. In present-day Hamelin, the blind Finja meets the deaf Jannik, who claims to have seen Finja and Ruben, a boy with a walking disability, in his dreams. The young people Finja, Jannik and Ruben witness mysterious events that seem to have something to do with the Pied Piper of Hamelin. Is the legend just an old myth or will the three soon have to fear for their own lives?
